intro: Echinops disfulensis, commonly known as the Afghan thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads and gray-green foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Echinops disfulensis is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
